title: XDMP-TOOMANYSTANDS when a forest is restarted too frequently
description:
Local Disk + DB Rep with flash backups : Forests getting into error state and documents missing at the end of stress test

I started DB Rep + Local Disk Failover stress test to verify this bug:
Bug 20601 -  Replica forest stays in "Finish Closing" for 3 minutes before going back to "Open Replica" state, when moved from flash-backup to all

Machines used:
Master Cluster:
rh5-amd64-failover-1 [E-Node]
rh5-intel64-21 [D-Node]
rh5-intel64-22 [D-Node]
  
Replica Cluster:
rh5-amd64-failover-2 [E-Node]
rh5-intel64-23 [D-Node]
rh5-intel64-24 [D-Node] 

Modified cronjobs to take "Modules", "Triggers" and "MedlineDB" databases into flash backup mode and out every 20 minutes on Master and replica (sleep 25 seconds after taking forests into flash backup mode before taking them back into updates allowed=all)

Cronjob on Master E-node:
0,20,40 * * * * /home/builder/flash_backup.sh

Cronjob on Replica E-node:
10,30,50 * * * * /home/builder/flash_backup.sh


I am seeing following Error on one of the forests in Master Cluster:
XDMP-FORESTERR: Error in startup of forest F1B-R: XDMP-RECOVERY: Recovery error on forest F1B-R after 1 redo records -- {{fsn=9875157, chksum=0x98058e30, words=2469}, op=insert, time=1361398836, mfor=7770072018240975050, mtim=13613442063879610, mfsn=9874702, fmcl=15575198503299167945, fmf=7770072018240975050, fmfsn=9874702, sk=3970617330858001244} XDMP-TOOMANYSTANDS: Too many stands

And the following Error on one of the forests in Replica cluster:
XDMP-FORESTERR: Error in startup of forest F1A-R: XDMP-RECOVERY: Recovery error on forest F1A-R after 0 redo records -- {{fsn=8178825, chksum=0x9bc948a0, words=3064}, op=replicateFragment, time=1361399540, mfor=0, mtim=0, mfsn=0, fmcl=0, fmf=0, fmfsn=0, sk=3253209527467517604} XDMP-TOOMANYSTANDS: Too many stands

I will attach the scripts I used to take the forests into flash-backup mode and out and also attach ErrorLogs from all the hosts.

changeHistory.comment:
Steps:
1. Setup Local disk Failover on Master and Replica.
2. Have modules to be used by shred.sh under Modules database.
3. Change FailoverTest appserver setting pointing modules to "Modules" database
4. Change qa appserver setting to use "basic" as authentication method.
5. change bootstrap hosts on both clusters to the ones on which Security-M and Security-R reside.
6. couple clusters and enable database replication between MedlineDB.
7. Copy attached xqy modules into qa appserver's root.
8. start medline.sh on master cluster.
9. setup cronjobs on Master and Replica with flash_backup.sh script (attached).

After loading about 10 million documents I see that forests are getting into Error state. 

Last night I saw the forests go into Error state much quicker if I have more number of forests (16 per host).

I spoke with Sundeep about this. He's transitioning to flash backup mode every 20 minutes, which worked for a while until a 20G merge needed to happen that could not finish in the 20 minutes. After that point in time, we started accumulating stands but never merging any and eventually we had too many stands.

I'm pushing this out to 5.0-6 because it's a contrived case that I wouldn't expect a user to hit in the real world.

I think a sufficient fix might be to not throw XDMP-TOOMANYSTANDS if the forest is recovering. This would allow the forest to at least get back to an open state at which time I think it would start rejecting new update transactions until a merge is able to successfully complete.
This does not need to be fixed in 6.0-4.
I don't think this needs to be fixed in ML6 at all, but it'd be good to resolve in ML7.
I don't think we should do anything to fix this.

fixed in 6.0-20130621
now during recovery:
the stand limit is double the normal value
there is no insert throttle so recovery should finish faster
merges are limited to 4GB so they should finish faster
